Karnataka: Private bus catches fire after collision with lorry in Chitradurga; several feared dead
description: A private bus caught fire in Karnataka's Chitradurga district early Thursday, with several feared dead and many injured. The bus was en route to Shivamogga from Bengaluru. In a separate incident, a state-run bus in Tamil Nadu collided with two vehicles after a tyre burst, killing nine people.

title: Grand Christmas Ball today in Chennai
description: The soiree is organised by Anglo-Indians but by no means restricted to them. In these times of dwindling Anglo-Indian presence even in enclaves with a distinctive Anglo-Indian flavour, this event signifies an effort to preserve a cultural tradition that has enriched Chennai

description: Extreme phobias, as forms of anxiety disorders, can cause mental impairments that lead to significant disabilities by interfering with a person’s social, occupational, and other important areas of functioning.

'Dhurandhar' BO collection Day 20: Ranveer Singh-led film shows no signs of slowing down
description: In a remarkable feat, Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' has soared to the top, officially becoming his highest-grossing film. This thrilling espionage drama has raked in an impressive Rs 607.25 crore domestically and surpassed Rs 900 crore globally within just 20 days. The film's cast has received resounding accolades for their powerful performances, all crafted brilliantly by director Aditya Dhar.

title: Environmental group raises concern over ‘excessive, prolonged spraying of defoamers in Yamuna’, calls for action against DJB
India-US ties: Envoy Vinay Kwatra meets Sergio Gor in Florida; trade talks in focus
description: India's Ambassador to the US, Vinay Mohan Kwatra, met with US Ambassador to India Sergio Gor at Mar-a-Lago to discuss strengthening trade ties and the bilateral partnership. The meeting, held during President Trump's holiday stay, also covered Gor's priorities for the India-US relationship. This interaction highlights the expanding scope of cooperation beyond trade, including the space sector.

Arunachal claims among Beijing’s core interests: Pentagon report
VHT: 'It was Sachin Tendulkar' - Shashi Tharoor makes bold Vaibhav Sooryavanshi claim
description: Fourteen-year-old Vaibhav Sooryavanshi continues to amaze after smashing a 36-ball century for Bihar in the Vijay Hazare Trophy. Veteran politician Shashi Tharoor compared his talent to a young Sachin Tendulkar. Suryavanshi scored 190, holds multiple age-records across formats, and is being hailed as one of Indian cricket’s brightest future stars.

title: Christmas Throwback: When Football silenced guns — and stopped a World War
description: On Christmas Day in 1914, World War I briefly paused as British and German soldiers laid down their weapons, met in no man’s land, and played football. Known as the Christmas Truce, the moment saw enemies sing carols, exchange gifts, and share humanity. For a few hours, football replaced hatred and became a symbol of peace.

title: ISRO rocket LVM-3 places 6000-kg US satellite – its heaviest – into orbit
Navi Mumbai airport opens today with 30 domestic flights
description: Navi Mumbai International Airport (NMIA) officially commenced commercial operations today, marking a significant expansion of air travel for the Mumbai region.  The airport will initially handle around 30 domestic flights daily, with IndiGo operating the first arrival and departure.  NMIA aims to scale up to round-the-clock services by February 2026.

title: Vaishnaw credits Make-in-India push for Bengaluru plant after Rahul Gandhi touts Karnataka ecosystem
description: The Union Minister thanked  the Congress leader for “acknowledging the success” of Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s Make-in-India programme.

title: India logs steep decline in TB, malaria and maternal deaths
description: India has achieved significant reductions in malaria, tuberculosis, and maternal/child deaths, marking a decisive phase in public health. These gains stem from sustained political will, scientific capacity, and public participation. While progress is evident, challenges remain in eliminating diseases and ensuring comprehensive life-course immunisation.

title: Bangladesh unrest: Acted mute to save myself - Indian Tabla player recalls trauma
description: Indian musicians Mainak Biswas and Kallab Ghosh faced intense anxiety in Dhaka after their concert was cancelled.  Trapped for 48 hours amidst rising anti-Indian sentiment, Biswas described the experience as a "worst nightmare," highlighting the fear of being targeted as a Hindu in Bangladesh. They managed to return home on December 22nd.

title: Students receive ₹35.70 lakh in sports participation incentives
BJP’s lack of pro-growth policies make trillion-dollar economy target for U.P. a pipe dream, says Samajwadi Party
description: There are structural development gaps in government plans, the party said

title: 'My son survived, but he can't see or walk': Deadly cough syrup victim's dad recounts ordeal
description: A father's life is shattered after his five-year-old son survived a deadly cough syrup but lost his sight and mobility. The family incurred massive debts for his prolonged treatment, with government aid falling short. While authorities investigate, the father pleads for future medical support, hoping his child can one day see the world.

title: Foreign court divorce binding if one spouse stays abroad, says Calcutta high court
description: The Calcutta High Court ruled that foreign courts can hear divorce and maintenance cases for marriages solemnised in India if a spouse resides there. This decision overturned a lower court's injunction on a UK court order, asserting that a UK family court has jurisdiction if parties last resided together in the UK.

title: Reports show Hemant Soren showed confidence in social security and welfare schemes in 2025
description: Continuous attacks from the Opposition and Mr. Soren’s alleged involvement in the liquor scam would be a challenge ahead for the government after the arrest of senior IAS officer Vinay Kumar Chaubey who once served as his Principal Secretary

title: India test fires 3,500-km missile from nuclear submarine
description: India successfully tested its K-4 intermediate-range ballistic missile from the nuclear-powered submarine INS Arighaat in the Bay of Bengal. This solid-fuelled missile, capable of carrying a two-tonne nuclear payload, is crucial for strengthening the sea leg of India's nuclear weapons triad. The test marks a significant step towards enhancing India's strategic deterrence capabilities.

title: Don’t come in support of Bangladeshis when they are sent back: Yogi cautions Opposition
Isro delivers its heaviest punch as Bahubali puts BlueBird into orbit
description: India's LVM3 rocket, nicknamed Baahubali, successfully launched the 6,100kg US satellite BlueBird Block-2, marking the heaviest spacecraft ever lifted from Indian soil. This ninth consecutive success for the human-rated launcher boosts confidence for the Gaganyaan mission and signals India's strong entry into the global LEO communications market.

title: Kerala: Kids singing Christmas carols attacked; parents protest BJP leader’s statement
description: Parents are protesting a BJP leader's statement that appeared to justify an attack on a children's Christmas carol group. The leader claimed the group was drinking and took a band set. Parents stated the group comprised only children aged 10-15. An RSS worker was arrested. The incident occurred Sunday night. Police reported the accused was intoxicated.

title: 'Bharat Taxi': Service to roll out soon? Amit Shah shares an update
description: Union Minister Amit Shah announced the upcoming launch of 'Bharat Taxi,' a new initiative by the Ministry of Cooperation. This service aims to create job opportunities for drivers and ensure they receive 100% of their earnings. 'Bharat Taxi' will also provide insurance facilities and allow advertisements on vehicles, enhancing driver welfare and customer convenience.

title: Actor Govinda among 40-star campaigners for municipal corporation polls for Shiv Sena
description: On January 15, political parties will contest in 29 MC covering 2,869 seats, and around 3.5 crore voters will participate in the exercise to appoint the public representatives

title: Two dining halls inaugurated for sanitation workers in Saidapet
Punjab & Haryana HC censures Punjab police over law and order; summons DGP
description: The Punjab and Haryana High Court has summoned the DGP to explain the lack of security at a stadium where a kabaddi player was murdered. The court expressed concern over criminals operating with impunity, highlighting the need for steps to curb organized crime and prevent future incidents.

title: Horoscope for 25 December 2025: Astrological Insights for Gemini, Capricorn, Libra, Leo, and All Sun Signs
Bombay HC raps BMC for ‘blind eye’ to air pollution, warns against new project sanctions
description: The court questions sanctioning of 125 mega projects, each worth over ₹1,000 crore, says the civic body has failed to enforce even basic compliance and suggested GPS and button cameras for flying squads

title: Aravali hills row: Centre to increase mining-free zones amid protests
description: The Union environment ministry is expanding prohibited mining areas in the Aravali hills following Supreme Court directives and public protests. The ministry has asked a central institution to identify additional zones for mining bans, aiming to further protect the mountain range's ecology and biodiversity.

title: Delhi airport assault: Cops collect CCTV footage of pilot assaulting flyer
description: Police are investigating an alleged assault at Delhi airport. A passenger claims an Air India Express pilot assaulted him after he objected to staff jumping the security queue. CCTV footage has been collected and statements recorded. The airline has removed the pilot from duty pending an internal inquiry. An FIR has been registered.

title: 'Country is safe': Modi govt brought peace to J&K, NE, Naxal-hit areas - Amit Shah
description: Home minister Amit Shah declared India has conquered long-standing security threats under the Modi government, highlighting peace in regions previously plagued by extremism and terrorism. Speaking at a police graduation ceremony, he urged new recruits to combat drugs and social evils, emphasizing the government's unwavering support for states in tackling crime. Shah also attended events honoring historical figures.

title: Thackerays join hands for a Mumbai that has changed beyond recognition
description: The Thackeray cousins invoked their grandfather and social reformist ‘Prabodhankar’ Thackeray along with their respective fathers, to emphasise on the lineage of the family that had fought for the Marathi manoos, stressing on how this was under threat again

title: Yunus keen to improve ties with India, says adviser
description: Dhaka signals an effort to ease strain with New Delhi, stressing that economic decisions, including rice imports, will be driven by cost and national interest rather than politics

title: Discovery of a million more potential Epstein documents delays further releases
description: Releases so far have contained extensive redactions, angering ‌some Republicans and doing little to ‌defuse a scandal threatening the party ahead of the 2026 midterm ‍elections

title: Rahul Gandhi's praise for Karnataka jobs affirms Make in India success - Vaishnaw:
description: Rahul Gandhi's praise for Karnataka's job creation, particularly Foxconn's hiring surge, has drawn a response from Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw. Vaishnaw credited Prime Minister Modi's 'Make in India' initiative, highlighting the nation's shift towards becoming a producer economy.

title: T.N. Police Hackathon 2025 held in Chennai
'She deserved it': Bengaluru techie shoots wife point-blank; planned murder for months
description: A chillingly planned murder saw a bank manager shot dead by her estranged software engineer husband in Bengaluru. The accused, showing no remorse, confessed to the premeditated act, even carrying a knife as a backup. Suspicions of infidelity reportedly fueled the violence, with the victim's family also alleging abuse against their children.

title: PM Modi to hold 3-day meet with chief secretaries, ease of business key agenda
description: Prime Minister Modi is convening a three-day summit with chief secretaries in Delhi to accelerate deregulation and enhance ease of business. The meeting will also focus on developing human capital to achieve India's developed nation status. Key themes include women and child welfare, education, sports, and skill development, with states presenting their initiatives.

title: NZ Tour of India: Spinner Lennox earns maiden call-up, Williamson to skip ODI series
description: Kane Williamson is unavailable for ODI selection due to his commitments in the SA20 league

title: Davante Adams injury update: Insider shares grim news ahead of Falcons game
description: The Los Angeles Rams' star player, Davante Adams, has been away from the field as the team recently lost to the Seattle Seahawks. This has sparked panic among fans as many expected Davante Adams to return to the field. Amid the mess, ESPN's Jeremy Fowler has shared a concerning update about Davante Adams.

title: Significant stride in Indian space sector: PM Modi on heaviest sat launch by Isro
description: India's 'Bahubali' rocket, LVM3-M6, successfully launched a 6,100 kg US satellite, BlueBird Block-2, into orbit, marking a significant milestone. This heaviest payload ever launched from India highlights the nation's growing prowess in the global space sector, capable of supporting large-scale satellite constellations and generating substantial foreign exchange revenue.

title: Bengaluru: Man sets teen’s mom ablaze for refusing his marriage proposal
description: A 28-year-old tenant allegedly set a 45-year-old grocery shop owner ablaze after she refused his proposal to marry her daughter. The incident occurred in Basaveshwaranagar after the owner, Geeta, repeatedly rejected the suspect's advances. Geeta is in critical condition, and police are searching for the accused.

title: Jaxson Dart vs Travis Hunter net worth 2025: Who is richer?
description: Travis Hunter leads Jaxson Dart in wealth from college NIL deals. Hunter's dual-position play and national appeal boost his earnings. Dart, a quarterback, has a lower but stable income. Both are NFL draft prospects. Hunter's market value increased after winning the Heisman Trophy. NFL contracts could alter their financial standings in the future.

title: Unnao rape case: Relocate me to Congress-led state, says survivor
description: Unnao rape survivor and her mother met Rahul and Sonia Gandhi seeking help in their legal battle against convicted attacker Kuldeep Sengar, who received bail. The survivor also requested relocation to a Congress-ruled state for safety, fearing for her life. Rahul Gandhi pledged legal assistance and support for her relocation, while condemning police action against her protest.

title: Union Cabinet clears 3 new metro stretches; network to cross 400 km

With construction progress as low as 4.9% on one 35-km stretch, the project's revised deadline is now at risk.

title: Taylor Swift’s subtle Kobe and Gianna Bryant tribute revealed in docuseries
description: Taylor Swift's Disney+ docuseries, 'The End of an Era,' features a subtle tribute to Kobe and Gianna Bryant. During a private rehearsal, Swift wore a "Mamba & Mambacita Sports" sweatshirt, a quiet acknowledgment of their legacy. This personal gesture, away from the stage, resonated with viewers who noted Swift's consistent, understated support for the Bryant family.

description: A Pentagon report reveals China's inclusion of Arunachal Pradesh among its core interests, alongside Taiwan and maritime disputes, as part of its national rejuvenation goals. The report also details deepening China-Pakistan military and strategic ties, including arms co-production and potential logistics facilities, while noting China's sensitivity to perceived threats to CCP legitimacy.

title: Nepal topples, B'desh boils & Pak teeters: How 2025 shook India's neighbours
No more lottery: How new H-1B visa selection system will work — key changes explained
description: After President Donald Trump proposed a $100,000 entry fee for new H-1B visa applications, the US Department of Homeland Security announced a major overhaul of the H-1B visa selection process. The department said that the long-standing random lottery system will be replaced with a wage-weighted model that prioritises higher-paid and higher-skilled applicants.

title: Nvidia may have just admitted that it cannot take Amazon, Google & Microsoft in Cloud
description: Nvidia has shelved its ambitious plan to directly challenge cloud giants like Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud, and Microsoft Azure. The chipmaker is now refocusing its DGX Cloud division inward, prioritizing its own engineers' AI model development. This strategic pivot aims to protect Nvidia's dominant AI chip market share, estimated at over 80%, rather than pursuing cloud revenue.

title: Paul Rudd reacts to Travis Kelce’s emotional apology after Chiefs playoff loss
description: Actor Paul Rudd shared his perspective on the Kansas City Chiefs' season. He highlighted the joy and memories the team has provided his family. Rudd embraced the team's elimination from playoff contention. He wished Patrick Mahomes a speedy recovery. Rudd also humorously suggested players deserved a break after a long season. He stated he was not too upset.

title: Taylor Swift opens up about cancer scare and Travis Kelce’s support
description: Taylor Swift opened up about a painful chapter during the Eras Tour, revealing how a backup singer’s cancer diagnosis deeply shook her tour family. The experience marked an emotional low point, but Swift said she later found renewed joy and stability in her personal life, crediting Travis Kelce with bringing light and happiness after an incredibly difficult period.

title: Randi Mahomes hosts holiday giveaway as Patrick Mahomes battles injury
description: The Kansas City Chiefs are navigating a difficult season, and quarterback Patrick Mahomes is sidelined with a significant injury. Amid this challenging time, Patrick Mahomes' mother, Randi Mahomes, is focusing on a different mission which is to support families raising young athletes.

title: Salesforce reboots AI strategy: Model errors raise concerns
description: Salesforce is scaling back its reliance on large language models due to reliability issues, shifting focus to deterministic automation in its Agentforce product. Executives acknowledge a decline in trust in AI models, with reported instances of models omitting instructions and losing focus. This strategic pivot follows significant support staff reductions attributed to AI agent deployment.
